CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the request of the applicant ’s defence counsel to cross - examine the witnesses in the criminal proceedings who lived in GPE . The court noted that some witnesses had confirmed their statements by cable and stated that they could not travel to ORG for financial reasons . The court ruled that it was necessary to examine the witnesses either in GPE or at their place of residence by a local judicial authority with jurisdiction under LAW . Taking into account lack of sufficient funds for travel and accommodation for the witnesses from the city of GPE in the city of ORG , the court opted for the international legal assistance mechanism and ordered that the appropriate NORP authorities be requested to conduct a judicial examination of the witnesses in GPE . The records of that examination would be used by ORG as evidence in the criminal case against the applicant . The court also noted that as an alternative the witnesses could be brought to ORG if the relevant authorities of GPE could cover their costs .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG . In the absence of any actions on the part of the applicant and his lawyer in this matter , the court did not establish any violation of the applicant ’s right to defence .

“ International treaties that are in force , agreed to be binding by the Verkhovna Rada of GPE , are part of the national legislation of GPE . ”
CARDINAL . Relevant provisions of the Code provide :

“ The procedure for communications between the courts , prosecutors , investigators , or inquiry authorities and the respective authorities of foreign GPE as well as the procedure for execution of mutual letters rogatory shall be established by legislation of GPE and international treaties to which GPE is a signatory . ”

“ Defence counsel shall use remedies available under this LAW and other legislative acts in order to ascertain the circumstances dispelling the suspicion or rebutting the charges , extenuating or excluding criminal liability on the part of the suspect , accused , defendant or convicted person , and shall provide them with the necessary legal assistance .
After having been permitted to provide legal representation in the proceedings , defence counsel shall have the right :

( CARDINAL ) to put questions in court to the defendants , victims , witnesses , and also to the expert , specialist , claimant or respondent , and to participate in the examination of other evidence ;

( CARDINAL) to adduce evidence , lodge requests or challenges , express in court his or her opinion on requests made by other participants in the judicial proceedings , appeal against acts or decisions of a person conducting an inquiry , or against those of the investigator , prosecutor , or court ; ...
( CARDINAL ) to collect information on matters which can be used as evidence in the case ; ... ”

“ Criminal evidence is any factual information on the basis of which the inquiry authority , the investigator and the court ascertain whether or not an act which is a danger to society has been committed , establish the guilt of the person who has committed the act , and any other circumstances relevant to the proper determination of the case .

Such information shall be established : from statements from witnesses , the victim , a suspect , an accused , and also from expert reports , material evidence , reports on investigative and judicial actions , reports DATE with relevant materials attached thereto – drawn up by the appropriate authorities on the results of detective and search activities , and other documents . ”
No evidence shall have a prejudicial effect on the court , prosecutor , investigator , or the person who conducts the inquiry . ”
“ Anyone known to be aware of the circumstances relating to the case may be summoned as a witness .

A witness may be questioned about the circumstances to be established in a particular case and , inter alia , about matters relating to the personality of the accused or the suspect and about the witness ’s relationships with the accused or the suspect . ”
